contentrichtext.text: {{otherpeople}}{{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Andrew Bennett |honorific-suffix = |image = |constituency_MP = [[Denton and Reddish (UK Parliament constituency)|Denton and Reddish]]<br /><small>[[Stockport North (UK Parliament constituency)|Stockport North]] (1974-1983)</small> |parliament = |majority = |term_start = 28 February 1974 |term_end = 5 May 2005 |predecessor = [[Idris Owen]] |successor = [[Andrew Gwynne]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1939|03|9|df=yes}} |birth_place = [[Barton-upon-Irwell]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] |otherparty = |spouse = Gillian Lawley |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = |occupation = |profession = |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = |signature = |website = }} '''Andrew Francis Bennett''' (born 9 March 1939) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] politician, who was a [[member of Parliament]] from 1974 to 2005. ==Early life== Bennett was born in [[Barton-upon-Irwell]]. He attended the [[William Hulme's Grammar School]] in [[Whalley Range, Greater Manchester|Whalley Range]]. He studied at the [[University of Birmingham]] gaining a BSocSc (Bachelor of Social Science). A geography teacher from 1960–74, Bennett was elected to [[Oldham]] Borough Council in 1964, and served on it until 1974. ==Parliamentary career== He contested the [[Knutsford (UK Parliament constituency)|Knutsford]] parliamentary seat in 1970 and was elected to Parliament in February 1974 for the marginal constituency of [[Stockport North (UK Parliament constituency)|Stockport North]], defeating the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] incumbent [[Idris Owen]] by just 203 votes. Following boundary changes, he was elected MP for Denton and Reddish in 1983. From 1983 to 1988 he served on the Labour [[front bench]] as a shadow Education and Science minister. He rebelled against the Labour government on various issues, including the privatisation of [[National Air Traffic Services]]. He retired at the [[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005 general election]], and the seat was held for Labour by [[Andrew Gwynne]]. ==Personal life== He married Gillian Lawley in 1961 in Manchester. They have two sons and a daughter. ==External links== * [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/2069559.stm BBC Profile] * [http://www.theyworkforyou.com/mp/andrew_bennett/denton_and_reddish They Work For You] * [http://www.publicwhip.org.uk/mp.php?id=uk.org.publicwhip/member/728 Public Whip] * {{Hansard-contribs | mr-andrew-bennett | Andrew Bennett }} {{start box}} {{s-par|uk}} {{s-bef | before = [[Idris Owen]] }} {{s-ttl | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Stockport North (UK Parliament constituency)|Stockport North]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, February 1974|1974]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 1983|1983]] }} {{s-non | reason = Constituency abolished }} {{s-new | constituency}} {{s-ttl | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Denton and Reddish (UK Parliament constituency)|Denton and Reddish]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1983|1983]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005]] }} {{s-aft | after = [[Andrew Gwynne]] }} {{end box}} {{Authority control|VIAF=106821259}} <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME= Bennett, Andrew |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=[[United Kingdom|British]] politician, former [[Member of Parliament]] |DATE OF BIRTH=1939-03-09 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Barton-upon-Irwell]] |DATE OF DEATH= |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bennett, Andrew}} [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs]] [[Category:Members of the United Kingdom Parliament for English constituencies]] [[Category:UK MPs 1974]] [[Category:UK MPs 1974–1979]] [[Category:UK MPs 1979–1983]] [[Category:UK MPs 1983–1987]] [[Category:UK MPs 1987–1992]] [[Category:UK MPs 1992–1997]] [[Category:UK MPs 1997–2001]] [[Category:UK MPs 2001–2005]] [[Category:People educated at William Hulme's Grammar School]] {{Labour-UK-MP-stub}}
